intro: Echites javanicus, commonly known as the Java spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Echites javanicus is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
